|brand = Cirago |model = USH1070 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 04/27/2013 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/Cirago_USH1070 |sernum = <!-- Serial number prefix --> |series = <!-- Device series -->

|controller_num = <!-- Number of controllers --> |chip1 = Terminus Technology;FE2.1; |chip2 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->
|pwr_optional = true |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|ports = 7 |tt = multi |power_led = green |port_led = |flags = power switch (global)

|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |estreldate = 02/2012 |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 858796051764 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B007JGBUT8 |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== This thing has a dedicated ''high-power'' charging port.. but a fairly low-specced power adapter. :Note: '''The charging port is for CHARGING ONLY.''' This is functionally a 6-port hub..
The power adapter included with the device is a '''FLYPOWER''' PS14K0502000U5 (100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz 0.35A -> 5VDC 2.0A).
The USH1070 (and the USB hub category) first appeared on the '''Cirago''' website [http://web.archive.org/web/20120209172203/http://cirago.com/wordpress/products/usb-hub/high-speed-usb-2-0-7-port-hub-%E2%80%93-with-dedicated-ipad-charging-port/ around February 2012]. This is presumed to be somewhat close to the release date..
[[Category:English Documentation]]
